Ratings.comment: Not clear directives.  Vague instructions.  No clear demonstrations of techniques.
Terrible.
Very grabby, not that I mind.
Great lecturer. She knows what is being taught and makes the class interesting.
Great Professor.  Expects a lot from students, but really knows her stuff, and will help you out if you ask.
Very nice! Easy A!
Mean and hurtful in verbal instructions.  Should not be teaching.  Gives the Department of Dance a bad name, and they cannot afford to have this type of bad reputation.

You can tell that she loves teaching the class. Was always energetic and happy to answer question. She was really harsh on grammatical errors and writing skills. Don't expect to get out of class early, ever. Very strict with attendance and lecture minutes. Lectures could be long and boring, but otherwise and an interesting class.

Its a dance history class but 70% or more of the grade is on your ability to write.  She's also very picky with attendance and details.  The slightest misdetail in a short answer question or essay will mean major points off.  She acts like the class is a 600 level or something, but its just introductory history.
Terrible teacher.  Verbally abusive.  No tact.  No manners.

This is not an easy GE. You have a discussion post due each week and it takes about an hour to complete if you want a good grade on it. I got 23/30 when I submitted my first posts. Once you learn how to write them the EXACT way the TAs want then I started getting 30/30. You have a quiz after each unit and you have 2 discussions/watch a movie for it

If you are taking this as easy GE class, DON'T. Weekly discussion boards that are graded insanely hard and if not written exactly how they want you get points off. The stuff they expect you to write is barely covered in the readings. 6 quizzes/exams which aren't as bad but you have to watch a movie. Even chat GTP won't save u. Prof is nice tho.

Worst class I have taken so far. Grades everything so hard and gives pages worth of reading that is expected. One discussion board per week which isn't bad but the questions are pointless. Doesn't matter that it isn't your major, you're expected to put your heart and soul into every discussion board. Felt like a complete waste of my time.
She is so sweet and so willing to help and figure out a solution if you are struggling.

The class itself wasn't too difficult. I don't think I watched any lectures past the first week and did fine. What does annoy me about this class though is that there were multiple instances we didn't have clear instructions. One week we were told to submit an essay draft Thursday and review groupmates by Sunday, but actually only the draft was due

This class is definitely not an easy course load. However, the material is not horribly difficult, but the exams are very heavy and require preparation on a time limit. Lots of group work and projects, so communication is key to succeeding. Overall, was a 6/10 difficulty and is kind of beneficial for anyone going into the healthcare field.

She is an extremely tedious grader, none of her coursework is organized. She doesn't record her own lectures, the exams have way too much content and not enough time to finish. Weekly, multiple, group assignments, extra readings, multiple lectures, multiple chapters. Do not take this class with this professor. Take an easier alternative.
Not clear directives.  Vague instructions.  No clear demonstrations of techniques.
Terrible.
Very grabby, not that I mind.
Great lecturer. She knows what is being taught and makes the class interesting.
Great Professor.  Expects a lot from students, but really knows her stuff, and will help you out if you ask.
Very nice! Easy A!
Mean and hurtful in verbal instructions.  Should not be teaching.  Gives the Department of Dance a bad name, and they cannot afford to have this type of bad reputation.

You can tell that she loves teaching the class. Was always energetic and happy to answer question. She was really harsh on grammatical errors and writing skills. Don't expect to get out of class early, ever. Very strict with attendance and lecture minutes. Lectures could be long and boring, but otherwise and an interesting class.

Its a dance history class but 70% or more of the grade is on your ability to write.  She's also very picky with attendance and details.  The slightest misdetail in a short answer question or essay will mean major points off.  She acts like the class is a 600 level or something, but its just introductory history.
Terrible teacher.  Verbally abusive.  No tact.  No manners.

There's a lot of reading to provide the information on that week's material. Exams are relatively simple and there are weekly discussions (as expected with an online course). Professor responds quickly and explains her expectations for assignments. There's a final paper and there's no cumulative final (just a quiz with each unit, there are 6 units)
So much busy work that is toughly graded.

If you're looking for an elective that is not time consuming, I would not recommend this course. The material is interesting, but everything could be a lot more concise. There are definitely easier electives with less time commitment you can take, so I wouldn't waste your time with this course.
she is so white and the class is so dry
just one of the best prof I have ever met
Great writing professor! Expect a lot of writing but it is easier than it first seems and he gives amazing feedback and is very caring and understanding.

Took this as a second level writing course and couldn't have loved him more. He really cares about students beyond just the way they perform in the classroom. He makes himself available and intentionally responds to feedback we gave him about what we liked/disliked with assignments. No tests/quizzes, just writing assignments/reflections but easy.

Steven was a good professor, and dance 2401 was an easy class. He understands that his students have other classes and activities going on. Only a few graded assignments in the class and the final is a group project.

This class was about film and dance history, and it mainly consisted of analyzing previous videos of performances. I enjoyed learning about innovations and changes made and all of the assignments were very easy. She was also great about telling you about the key points you may have missed in a quiz or discussion post.

I took Irish Step with Kathryn. I had no previous dance experience, but by the end of the semester I could preform multiple soft shoe, hard shoe, and ceili dances! It was a lot of fun. There were a few papers and discussion posts required in addition to participation in class. She was very kind and understanding. Overall I had a great experience!

I would first like to preface this by saying this is obviously a dance class. You learn about dances from different cultures. There are two readings per week and they are usually 60 pages each, along with some writing after. Can be difficult to juggle with the research paper she assigns you. Do not take this if genocide and death are triggering.

Lots of reading in this class, however, Kathryn does a good job with going over them in class in case you didn't understand them. Attendance is taken every class - so you have to go. Weekly reading assignments, 3 (easy) online quizzes, and a lot of small group discussions. Kathryn is really flexible with deadlines and due dates - it's nice!
